intro: Antirrhoea tenuifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved antirrhinum, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and clusters of tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers, which range in color from pink to purple, bloom in spring and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Antirrhoea tenuifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
